trans-unit.source: Technical Overview
trans-unit.target: Technical Overview

trans-unit.source: A technical overview of Service Fabric. Discusses key concepts and architectural overview
trans-unit.target: A technical overview of Service Fabric. Discusses key concepts and architectural overview

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric is a distributed systems platform that makes it easy to build scalable, reliable, low-latency, and easily managed applications for the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric is a distributed systems platform that makes it easy to build scalable, reliable, low-latency, and easily managed applications for the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This means that you can focus on your business needs and let Service Fabric take care of ensuring your application is always available and scales.
trans-unit.target: This means that you can focus on your business needs and let Service Fabric take care of ensuring your application is always available and scales.

trans-unit.source: Cluster - A network connected set of virtual or physical machines into which application instances are deployed.
trans-unit.target: Cluster - A network connected set of virtual or physical machines into which application instances are deployed.

trans-unit.source: Clusters can scale to thousands of machines.
trans-unit.target: Clusters can scale to thousands of machines.

trans-unit.source: Node - An addressable unit in a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Node - An addressable unit in a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Nodes have characteristics such as placement properties and unique IDs.
trans-unit.target: Nodes have characteristics such as placement properties and unique IDs.

trans-unit.source: Nodes can join a cluster and correlate to an operating system instance with Fabric.exe running.
trans-unit.target: Nodes can join a cluster and correlate to an operating system instance with Fabric.exe running.

trans-unit.source: Application / Application Type - A collection of (micro)services.
trans-unit.target: Application / Application Type - A collection of (micro)services.

trans-unit.source: Think of an application type as a container for one or more service types.
trans-unit.target: Think of an application type as a container for one or more service types.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the <linkText>Application Model</linkText><title></title> article to understand how a cluster (which itself consists of multiple nodes) may consist of multiple ApplicationTypes.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the <linkText>Application Model</linkText><title></title> article to understand how a cluster (which itself consists of multiple nodes) may consist of multiple ApplicationTypes.

trans-unit.source: Service / Service Type - Code and configuration that performs a standalone function (it can start and run independently), for example, a queue service or database service.
trans-unit.target: Service / Service Type - Code and configuration that performs a standalone function (it can start and run independently), for example, a queue service or database service.

trans-unit.source: An ApplicationType may consist of one ore more ServiceTypes.
trans-unit.target: An ApplicationType may consist of one ore more ServiceTypes.

trans-unit.source: There are two kinds of services types:
trans-unit.target: There are two kinds of services types:

trans-unit.source: Stateless service: A service that has state where the state is persisted to external storage, such as Azure Databases or Azure Table store.
trans-unit.target: Stateless service: A service that has state where the state is persisted to external storage, such as Azure Databases or Azure Table store.

trans-unit.source: If a node on which an instance of this service is active goes down, another instance is automatically started on another node.
trans-unit.target: If a node on which an instance of this service is active goes down, another instance is automatically started on another node.

trans-unit.source: Stateful service: A service that has state and achieves reliability through replication between replicas on other nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Stateful service: A service that has state and achieves reliability through replication between replicas on other nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Stateful services have a primary and multiple secondary replicas.
trans-unit.target: Stateful services have a primary and multiple secondary replicas.

trans-unit.source: If a node on which a replica of this service is active goes down, a new replica is started on another node and if this was the primary replica, a secondary replica is automatically promoted to a new primary.
trans-unit.target: If a node on which a replica of this service is active goes down, a new replica is started on another node and if this was the primary replica, a secondary replica is automatically promoted to a new primary.

trans-unit.source: Application Instance - In a cluster you can create many application instances of an application type, each of which has a specific name.
trans-unit.target: Application Instance - In a cluster you can create many application instances of an application type, each of which has a specific name.

trans-unit.source: Each application instance can be independently managed and versioned from other application instances of the same type or different type.
trans-unit.target: Each application instance can be independently managed and versioned from other application instances of the same type or different type.

trans-unit.source: Additionally they define resource and security isolation.
trans-unit.target: Additionally they define resource and security isolation.

trans-unit.source: Service Instance - Code that has been instantiated for a service type.
trans-unit.target: Service Instance - Code that has been instantiated for a service type.

trans-unit.source: Each service instance has a unique name starting with fabric:/ and is associated with an particular named application instance.
trans-unit.target: Each service instance has a unique name starting with fabric:/ and is associated with an particular named application instance.

trans-unit.source: Application Package - The collection of service code packages and the configuration files combined for a particular application.
trans-unit.target: Application Package - The collection of service code packages and the configuration files combined for a particular application.

trans-unit.source: These are the physical files that are deployed and is simply a file and folder format layout.
trans-unit.target: These are the physical files that are deployed and is simply a file and folder format layout.

trans-unit.source: For example, an application package for an email application could contain a queue service package, a frontend service package, and a database service package.
trans-unit.target: For example, an application package for an email application could contain a queue service package, a frontend service package, and a database service package.

trans-unit.source: Programming Models - There are two programming models available in Service Fabric to build applications:
trans-unit.target: Programming Models - There are two programming models available in Service Fabric to build applications:

trans-unit.source: Reliable Services - An API to build stateless and stateful services based on StatelessService and StatefulService .NET classes, storing state in .NET reliable collections (Dictionary and Queue) and with the ability to plug in a variety of communication stacks such as Web API and WCF.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Services - An API to build stateless and stateful services based on StatelessService and StatefulService .NET classes, storing state in .NET reliable collections (Dictionary and Queue) and with the ability to plug in a variety of communication stacks such as Web API and WCF.

trans-unit.source: This programming model is suitable for applications where you need to perform compute across multiple units of state.
trans-unit.target: This programming model is suitable for applications where you need to perform compute across multiple units of state.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Actors - An API to build stateless and stateful objects through the virtual Actor programming model which is suitable for applications with multiple independent units of state and compute.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Actors - An API to build stateless and stateful objects through the virtual Actor programming model which is suitable for applications with multiple independent units of state and compute.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Service Fabric, see:
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Service Fabric, see:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Model</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Scenarios</linkText><title></title>
